Class SqliteUserDataDAO

All Implemented Interfaces:
IUserDataDAO
public class SqliteUserDataDAO extends Object implements IUserDataDAO
SQLITE DAO class which handles the communication between the application and the database

  • Constructor Details

    • SqliteUserDataDAO

      public SqliteUserDataDAO(int userID)
      Initialises an instance of the database connection. It's important that a userID is passed here such that the application knows which table to access. Ultimately all user data stored in the database should be encrypted with a user specific key to prevent an unauthorised user from accessing another users data however this is currently out of scope.
      Parameters:
      userID - The user ID of the user whose data is to be accessed

  • Method Details

    • addUserData

      public void addUserData(UserData data)
      Attempts to add a new user data point to the database. This method required a UserData object which will then be published to the user's UserData table
      Specified by:
      addUserData in interface IUserDataDAO
      Parameters:
      data - An object of type UserData which is to be added to the Database

    • updateUserData

      public void updateUserData(UserData data)
      Updates a user data object that has been modified by the program
      Specified by:
      updateUserData in interface IUserDataDAO
      Parameters:
      data - The Data object which is to be updated in the database.

    • getUserDataInRange

      public List<UserData> getUserDataInRange(int startDate, int endDate)
      Gets user data that is within the specified range
      Specified by:
      getUserDataInRange in interface IUserDataDAO
      Parameters:
      startDate - The date at which to start looking for data as a string.
      endDate - The date at which to stop looking for data as a string.
      Returns:

    • getAllUserData

      public List<UserData> getAllUserData()
      A function which returns all a user's data... this is likely to never be used however as grabbing specific time periods makes more sense and would keep compute times down
      Specified by:
      getAllUserData in interface IUserDataDAO
      Returns:

      Specified by:

    • deleteAllUserData

      public void deleteAllUserData(User user)
      Drops the user data table if the user selects to clear all their user data
      Specified by:
      deleteAllUserData in interface IUserDataDAO
      Parameters:
      user - The user who is initiating the action.
